Q_DESC:
Ria has excellent skills in programming.To boost her intelligence,her class teacher gave her a problem to Count the no:of substrings.

Problem :
Her Class teacher gave her n strings numbered from 1 to n which consists of only lowercase letters (each having length not more than 10) and then ask Q questions related to the given strings.

Each question is described by the 2 integers L,R and a string str,Now her teacher wants to know how many strings numbered from L to R contains str as a substrings.

As expected, Ria solved this problem. What might be her code?

INPUT
First line of input contains a single integer n denoting the number of strings given by class teacher to jack.Next n lines of input contains n strings (one per line).Next line fo input contains a single integer Q denoting the number of questions asked by his teacher.next Q lines of input contains Q question (one per line) as explained above.

OUTPUT
print the correct answer for each of the question asked by his teacher.

CONSTRAINTS
1<=n<=10000
1<=strlen(str)<=10
1<=Q<=5*10^5
1<=L,R<=n

NOTE: strings consist of only lower case characters
